snippet: The automaker will use a selective catalytic reduction control system on its future diesel engines in Europe and North America, where a scandal erupted last month.
abstract: Volkswagen announces that it will switch to selective catalytic reduction system to reduce emissions from diesel exhaust in newer car models in response to emissions cheating scandal that erupted in September; company also announces it will reduce investments in its leading brand by 1 billion euros, or around $1.1 billion.
lead_paragraph: The automaker will use a selective catalytic reduction control system on its future diesel engines in Europe and North America, where a scandal erupted last month.

headline.main: Volkswagen, in Future Cars, to Adopt New System for Controlling Diesel Emissions
headline.print_headline: VW to Alter Its Diesel Emission System
